meanings.definition: Strike with a whip or stick.
meanings.sent1: The cowboy would lash the horse to make it run faster.
meanings.sent2: She watched as the blacksmith would lash the hot metal to shape it.
meanings.sent3: The pirate captain would lash the crew for not following orders.
meanings.sent4: The storm would lash the coast with powerful winds and rain.
meanings.sent5: The angry teacher would lash out at the students for misbehaving.

meanings.definition: A strip of leather or other material used for tying or fastening things.
meanings.sent1: She used a leather lash to tie the branches together.
meanings.sent2: The lash on the bag broke, so she couldn't close it properly.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape had a golden lash that shimmered in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The lash of the belt kept her sword secure by her side.
meanings.sent5: The lash of the whip was intricately braided for durability.

meanings.definition: A sudden or forceful movement in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: The sudden lash of the wind blew the hat off his head.
meanings.sent2: The lash of the waves against the shore was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected lash of the cat's tail knocked over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The lash of the car as it sped past startled the pedestrians.
meanings.sent5: The lash of the dancer's skirt added flair to her performance.
